FuncDef:
The whitelist session-car dhcp-server disable command disables the DHCPv4 session CAR function.
The undo whitelist session-car dhcp-server disable command enables the DHCPv4 session CAR function.
By default, the DHCPv4 session CAR function is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The DHCPv4 session CAR function is enabled by default. It isolates packet channels between DHCPv4 sessions, preventing packets over different DHCPv4 sessions from preempting bandwidth resources. To disable this function on a device, run the whitelist session-car dhcp-server disable command. DHCPv4 packets received by this device will then be sent directly through the DHCPv4-specific CPCAR channel. If the device receives a large number of DHCPv4 packets, packets from different DHCPv4 sessions preempt bandwidth resources. Therefore, disabling this function is not usually recommended.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
